posts.post_content: Color-change was rampant in Invasion. This combo'd with a [Tidal Visionary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tidal Visionary) and many other cards in the set made some good limited tricks.

Posted By: BegleOne (11/13/2010 9:08:50 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A better version of deathtouch against white creatures. Doesn't require damage being dealt, simply destroys white creatures as a triggered effect as soon as they are declared blockers.
  
   
Still, pretty mana-expensive for what is, at best, a 2 damage repeat swinger against a white deck that can still be blocked if they have creatures to spare.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
[Lure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lure ) and [Painter's Servant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Painter's Servant). Clear's the skies. Works better with its brother [Phyrexian Reaper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Reaper), of course, but a one sided Wrath effect with the creature surviving is nothing to scoff at.  
  
Not saying he's great, but he can do a lot of things that other creature's can't. Like kill [Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitus).
posts.html:

Posted By: DoragonShinzui (9/12/2012 1:07:54 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
According to its wording, it can technically destroy white creatures with Protection from Black. PoB means:  
  
1) The creature cannot be damaged by a black source, 2) the creature cannot be targeted by a black source, and 3) the creature cannot be blocked by a black creature.  
  
Slayer's ability doesn't violate any of the above, so it can kill PoB white creatures.
posts.html:
According to its wording, it can technically destroy white creatures with Protection from Black. PoB means:

1) The creature cannot be damaged by a black source, 2) the creature cannot be targeted by a black source, and 3) the creature cannot be blocked by a black creature.

Slayer's ability doesn't violate any of the above, so it can kill PoB white creatures.
